tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Abortion / Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP),Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),
review:
I am delighted to share my birthing experience with Dr. Vinutha Maam at Divine Women‚Äôs Healthcare Center. We started our journey in January 2023 after reading positive reviews on Practo and Google. Choosing her as my Obstetrician-gynecologist was a great decision. ‚ÄúAn open heart and a skilled hand make the best Doctor‚Äù. She is supportive, patient, and really listens to our concerns, offering guidance and counselling if necessary. 

In January 2023, I visited Divine Women‚Äôs Healthcare Center for best opinion on my first pregnancy. Unfortunately, due to cardiac anomalies, we had to consider an abortion. Maam explained everything in detail and supported us through the difficult decision. 
Unfortunately, my second pregnancy also resulted in a missed miscarriage and I was utterly heartbroken. Dr. Vinutha Maam  reassured me that I could still conceive a healthy baby naturally in the future.

With God‚Äôs grace I conceived again in November 2023 and now I am blessed with a healthy baby girl through Normal/Vaginal delivery. Throughout the journey she helped me to be strong and prepared for the Vaginal delivery. I followed Vinutha maam‚Äôs each advice, took prescribed medicines on time, practiced yoga, and maintained blood pressure and sugar levels to achieve normal/Vaginal delivery. 

Each visit to the clinic was positive and uplifting. Dr. Vinutha Maam was always available to address my concerns over call or through messages on WhatsApp. *** **** ********** ********* ***** *** ****** ****** *** ******* ****** *** *************
I am very grateful for the beautiful journey and already I miss seeing her regularly now in the post-pregnancy phase. Once again Thank you so much Maam for making my pregnancy journey more beautiful.
I highly recommend Dr. Vinutha Maam to anyone seeking an Obstetrician-gynecologist and those who wants to have a great pregnancy journey. You will never regret by choosing her as your Doctor.

review: ** ******* ********* ** *** ** *** **** ****** * **** I consulted her for my second pregnancy and she gave us good guidance and support before pregancy and throughout my pregancy journey  until my delivery ,  she is very supportive and helpful and listen to our problems and clear all the doubts and this gave us a warmth feeling  and I had a labour pain in early morning but the Doctor made sure that everything was taken care in the hospital and she was there for us early morning and our baby was delivered normally by safe hands. With Doctors advice and guidance Normal delivery was a easy and effortless.

context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnancy care and management,
review:
Hi,
Regarding Dr. Vinutha Prashanth, the consultation provided for us was very comfortable and confident during our pregnancy period. She was very positive and pushed us maximum for normal delivery. 
We could have open discussions without fear or hesitation during such a significant time. We felt well-supported by her. She provided clear and concise consultations without unnecessary interventions like injections or scans during our pregnancy. It's important for expectant parents to have a smooth and stress-free experience.

review:
I can‚Äôt begin to express how grateful I‚Äôm to Dr Vinutha mam for her dedication .
I was 12 weeks with IVF conception and DCDA twins with lots of questions and worries in my mind when I met Vinutha mam.
The moment I consulted for the 1st time my entire thoughts changed positively about twin pregnancy, she is such a gem and gave me more strength and confidence every visit and ** *********** **** **** *****

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I wanted to take a moment to express my deepest gratitude for the exceptional care you provided during my recent delivery. From the moment I first met you, I knew I was in good hands, but your professionalism, empathy, and expertise truly exceeded my expectations.Throughout the entire journey, you not only displayed immense medical knowledge but also a genuine concern for my well-being and that of my baby. Your calm demeanor and reassuring words were a source of immense comfort during what could have been a stressful time.Your attention to detail and clear communication throughout the process ensured that I felt informed and empowered every step of the way. Your dedication to your profession is truly inspiring, and it is evident that you are not only a skilled doctor but also a compassionate caregiver.I cannot thank you enough for the safe delivery of my baby and for making the entire experience as smooth as possible. Your support extended beyond the delivery room, and I felt confident in your care throughout my recovery.I would wholeheartedly recommend you to anyone seeking a gynecologist who combines expertise with genuine care. Thank you once again for everything you have done for me and my  familyWith deepest gratitude,Manasa R

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: I thank with great heart Dr. Vinutha who has been the sweetest doctor I have ever met - your care and attention from beginning to end was amazing. We are so grateful that you took the time to listen to all our fears and concerns. You allayed them and allowed us to focus on enjoying the pregnancy. The last thing we expected was an emergency C-section but thank you for being there and getting us through it. We got our miracle baby boy and we are eternally grateful to you.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I met Dr.Vinutha at my 21 week pregnency check up ....after my return from UK.
My case was quite high risk as I'm 43 and also had Gestational diabetes and Thyroid issues.
At my first meet itself Dr.Vinutha put me at ease by her very supportive and understanding talk and also eased my anxiety.
She made sure I had all tests done to rule any abnormalities as per norms .
At around 32 weeks ...my hypertension rose a bit high and I had to be hospitalized....there Dr.and her team were very very supportive...she took the correct decisions and also explained to us in detail why the measures were being undertaken and also when my baby started showing signs of Intra Uterine Growth retardation...she made sure we did not panic and delivered our baby at 34 weeks ....and after short period of NICU stay our baby girl was with us 
In totality Dr.Vinutha is a kind gentle hearted person.
She has a holistic approach to treatment and also is very open to discuss and take opinions from the patients prospective.
I shall always be grateful to her for her relentless support and also attentive care taking and a very very motherly touch.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
I visited Cloudnine hospital and consulted Dr Vinutha for my pregnancy checkup and after the first visit and interacting with her we understood that it was an ectopic, where our happiness was collapse, but the way she handled the situation I was confident enough to continue my medication,  her knowledgeable and takes the time to thoroughly explain medical conditions, making complex information easy to understand. I appreciate her compassionate approach, making me feel comfortable discussing sensitive health matters. she listens attentively and addresses concerns with empathy and expertise. I trust Dr. Vinutha for her accurate diagnoses and comprehensive treatment plans.Her caring nature extends beyond the physical realm, as she prioritizes not only the well-being of her patients. She has been very helpful and encouraging to take care of myself and She filled me with all positivity and helped me prepare myself mentally and physically to come out from the trauma. Thank You Doctor Vinutha 
I highly recommend her to others.

Dr Vinutha is an experts in her work, highly professional I  read the reviews and visited her, as a couple we decided to take her service without any hesitation for my first pregnancy, trust her & follow her instructions,  she is not fancy, no sugar coated words, highly transparent ** *********** **** etc she ensured to stay connected from day one available on her mobile it‚Äôs hard to find doctors like her we are glad she helped me hold my bundle of joy on July 1st 2024. Good luck to you!

review: I consulted doctor Vinutha for my 1st pregnancy. I am very happy that I chose doctor Vinutha.From day 1 to the day of delivery her support and guidance was tremendous.She explains everything clearly and pays attention to details. ******* ********* *********** ***** ** ****** **** Throughout my pregnancy she made me feel very comfortable. I wanted normal delivery and she supported for the same.Because of her I did not go to my hometown and stayed here and my decision turned out right.Overall a great experience and happy to have found safe hands. I highly recommend her.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: It's my second pregnancy experience with vinutha madam . Irrespective of my travel distance is 2 hour   in banglore traffic to clinic I have chosen her it's because of trust and confidence I and my family had on her and I was more comfortable getting treated by her than any other gyno near my house or anyone in city.Professional ethics and service mindset makes vinutha madam standout in a crowd .You can blindly trust her and she is open to discuss anything and everything in calm and positive way .She always thinks in patients shoe and try to give the best she can offer for her patients.Let me tell you the Birth story of Bheem(#mynsecond son name)...When I got to know I am conceived ,there was no second thought other than visiting vinutha madam but travel was challenging because we shifted house recently to other part f banglore which is 40kms away from clinic and traffic will be huge always...but still i made dare to take risk and visited her till  9 months it was all happy and healthy pregnancy till last scan...at end of 36 week vinutha madam asked me for growth scan as my tummy seems to be tiny ...and got to know baby is transverse position and amniotic fluid is less and baby is not growing fastly so she started talking about Plan B if it is not normal but she told not to loose hope till last minute anything can happen if baby supports...if baby is turning will wait till  EDD ...but i was suffering with acidity and was unable to swallow food at end of delivery so i called and told her can't wait more days and it's getting difficult and i will go for c section...she convinced me to wait and the EDD has arrived it was 10th may and no labour pain untill then  so she asked me to admit night and induced pain to me at 11 P.M . Night is full of rain, thunderstorms and lights ...she was continuously checking with duty doctor about my status and early morning my water has broken and she arrived hospital  morning and delivered baby boy normally without epidural ...She won againüòç I and my family owe her and no words to express our gratitude.These days it's very rare to see dedicated doctor like Dr.Vinutha madam ..Whenever risks in pregnancy, her  attitude of handling things are mind-blowing .If you want  Magic in  pregnancy journey meet Vinutha doctor once :)I wish her success in all future endeavours.Hearful Thanks and Respect from,Arpitha and Raviteja

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Most humble and friendly in nature. For a first time pregnant it is always needed a most comfortable and approachable gynecologist. In such case Dr. Vinutha was a right choice. I'm glad that I found right place and person for my first pregnancy.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I consulted doctor vinutha for my 2nd pregnancy with twins, It was good experience with her as she guided me in all the ways and helped me in understanding the difficulties which may occur during the pregnancy, I have undergone c-section as babies were not in position, finally I am out with healthy babies because of doctor Vinutha.

She has very good experience and I would definitely suggest her for every one.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,
review: My sister recommended Dr. Vinutha to me when I was pregnant with my second child. She gave me an explanation of every stage of the pregnancy and the pregnancy risk factors specific to my RH-ve blood group from the day I first spoke with her until the day of child birth. She assisted with the delivery of the healthy child by providing continuous monitoring through scans, as I was ICT positive, which had an impact on the baby. She continuously monitored and expertly managed my postpartum hemorrhage during the delivery. When it comes to managing high-risk pregnancies, she excels. Many thanks to the doctor for all of her support and assistance.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,
review:
I consulted Dr. Vinutha B for my first pregnancy and her support and guidance from day 1 till the last minute of delivery was immense, she is very simple and straight forward in approach which is really good.
She doesn't suggest unnecessary medicines or lab tests
 Each stage of pregnancy she explained in detail with report about the process and progress. She always focuses on getting normal delivery and makes plan accordingly which we do not come across much in present generation, even my case was little complex during the time of delivery where she did not give up and took it as a challenge and delivered normally for which I would be greatfull and thankful forever. Overall great experience and happy that I was in safe hands, anyone looking out for recommendations, I would highly recommend Dr. Vinutha to be part of your pregnancy journey.

From day one she will be with you till the time she delivers

review: I would really thank Vinutha ma'am for helping me in smooth pregnancy journey. She use to always clear all my doubts and level up my confidence. She use to provide positive vibes. When I had severe muscle catch during 7th month pregnancy, she helped me to regain my confidence. I would really suggest Vinutha ma'am for pregnancy checkup Or any health related issues.

tags: None
review:
Dr. Vinutha was very friendly and caring during all the consultations we had during and after the pregnancy. She answered all our queries, most of the time our query were already answered by her precautionary suggestions.

She kept my wife on minimum medication supplements. And asked her to do all house hold chores as usual, walking and yoga for normal delivery. Super happy to find a doctor in this day and age who adviced and almost tried her best to prevent c section and other invasive procedures.

Finally thanks to Dr. Vinutha for her perseverance, support and all the lectures she gave to prevent us from opting for C-Section in the labour room. 

We will have a long lasting relationship with the Dr. as she was like a friend and guide throughout this journey. 

Thanks Dr. Vinutha Prasanna

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Firstly ratings/reviews are not enough to describe about Dr.Vinutha Madam. She deserves more than that.

I have been consulting Dr.Vinuta from the beginning of my pregnancy. She is super cool, humorous, simple and does not prescribe unnecessary scans/tests or medicine.

There are not enough words to describe how thankful we are for our wonderful Normal Delivery. The confidence that she builds during the delivery time is highly appreciated. During last weeks of pregnancy my baby weight and amniotic fluid level started decreasing trend and Dr.Vinutha waits till near due date with necessary monitoring and then takes a decision based on the medical situation.

Finally, we are blessed with Baby Boy on auspicious day Akshaya Tritiya. It was the best decision choosing her as gynecologist. Highly recommended her for pregnancy Journey.

review:
Exceptional Care and Expertise for a Joyous Journey through Pregnancy

We recently had the privilege of working with Dr. Vinutha Prashanth throughout the entire duration of my wife's pregnancy, and we cannot recommend him/her highly enough. From our very first consultation to the delivery of our beautiful baby, Dr. Vinutha Prashanth displayed unwavering dedication, remarkable expertise, and genuine compassion towards my wife's well-being.

First and foremost, Dr. Vinutha Prashanth ensured that my wife always felt comfortable and thoroughly understood throughout her entire pregnancy journey. This included taking the time to answer all our questions, explain medical terminologies in layman terms, and provide valuable advice regarding prenatal care and healthy lifestyle choices. Without hesitation, Dr. Vinutha Prashanth patiently guided us through each step, making the entire process much less daunting.

What truly set Dr. Vinutha Prashanth apart was the level of attentiveness and personalized care my wife received. Whether it was performing routine check-ups, monitoring the baby's growth, or analyzing various tests and ultrasounds, Dr. Vinutha Prashanth was meticulous in ensuring that everything was progressing smoothly. We felt genuinely cared for during each visit and appreciated the frequent opportunities to discuss any concerns or fears that emerged along the way.

From day one, it was evident that Dr. Vinutha Prashanth was highly knowledgeable and skilled in their field. Their experience and expertise were evident as they meticulously tracked and managed my wife's pregnancy progress, addressing any potential red flags promptly. Their guidance extended beyond pre-natal care, as Dr. Vinutha Prashanth prepped us for the delivery process, leaving us feeling confident and prepared for the big day.

The level of care and support exhibited by the entire staff at Dr. Vinutha Prashanth's clinic was extraordinary. From the warm greetings during reception to the nursing team's attentiveness, we consistently felt valued and well-cared for in every aspect of our experience.

Ultimately, thanks to Dr. Vinutha Prashanth's exceptional care, we welcomed a healthy baby into the world. Our gratitude toward Dr.Vinutha Prashanth goes beyond words, as their expertise and genuine compassion guided us through a joyous and oftentimes nervous journey.

If you're seeking a gynecologist who will provide unrivaled care during your pregnancy, we wholeheartedly. Their dedication, proficiency, and personal attention make them an outstanding choice for anyone embarking on this incredible journey.

Thank you, Dr. Vinutha Prashanth, for helping us welcome our bundle of joy and for ensuring my wife's pregnancy was managed with utmost care. You have our deepest appreciation and highest recommendation.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
This was my 3rd pregnancy. I had 2 previous mid term abortions because of cervical incompetence. During the 2nd pregnancy, I had an emergency McDonald's cerclage placed by Dr Vinutha in the 19th week but it eventually failed. With this background, this time around Dr Vinutha suggested Shirodkar's stitch in the 12th week. Post that I was completely on bed rest. 

Apart from the monthly doctor visits, I seldom stepped out of my room. Dr. Vinutha's motivating words helped me a lot during this anxious period. The doctor was always available to answer my queries and concerns over WhatsApp. Dr Vinutha would also encourage me to share my scan/ blood reports over WhatsApp. This helped me avoid multiple trips to the clinic. 

In the 29th week, I got my Growth scan done. Things looked normal and I was happy since the pregnancy was progressing well. Two days later I started feeling a lot of pain in my back. The pain intensified the next day and by the time I visited the hospital, my water broke. Dr. Vinutha immediately administered steroid injections and put me on the strongest possible pain killers. She had multiple plans in place to handle my condition. Intensivist, physician, anaesthetist and neonatalogist were all informed about my case. We were able to delay the delivery by 57hrs. In this duration, I was given 2 doses of steroids and Magnesium sulphate which helped my baby's development. I delivered my baby girl at 29+3 weeks and 41 days later the baby was healthy and ready to go home.

I would like to thank Dr. Vinutha for her guidance throughout my high-risk pregnancy journey. The way she handled my delivery situation is truly laudable.

review:
We are extremely happy with the treatment and guidance provided by Dr. Vinutha  Mam, she  was the main pillar throughout my  pregnancy journey & she's been very kind enough and treated me like her own family member since the beginning until our baby's delivery. She is so down to earth and always setting a very positive tone for every patient. God was so kind that they paved the way to Vinutha Mam . It was our second delivery and we moved from Pune to Bangalore on 5th month of our pregnancy .. on our initial reports done in Pune , there were many complications like blood flow was less to baby , amnoitic fluid was less and many more ..with many uncertainty about our pregnancy we landed in Bangalore, me and my husband are in search of a good doctor. After seeing the reviews , we took the appointment with Vinutha Mam , infact I would say Destiny made us to meet with Vinutha Mam.From our first visit , she was so patiently listening all our story and assured not to worry at all and suggested to do very few scans. In our second visit , she ensured evrything is fine and not to worry. I can't explain it was so relieving and Blissful.. we were sure we are in safe hands. For any query and advice , she was just a call or message away .She never suggests unnecessary scans or multiple visit to hospital if everything is fine. She will listen all our queries , infact few are silly , and very patiently replies and clarifies all our doubts and suggests the best. It was so smooth till the delivery, Then as due date was near by she informed all pros and cons of both normal and CS as my first baby was born by CS. And one more good thing is: she is so transparent , she gives the best of advices and we knew she knows the best ,and we went for the one which was best for both baby and mother ..finally the day has arrived and we delivered our baby and there were many complications during the cs due to previous surgery and the Vinutha Mam and her experienced  team handled evrything so smoothly and baby was delivered with no risk factors. 

Me and my family are so indebted with her treatment during my pregnancy journey. I highly recommend Vinutha Mam if you are looking for a good doctor for your pregnancy journey. She is so positive , down to earth , transparent and very friendly. During pregnancy , you need a doctor who listens to you patiently and gives the best of advices. She is the one who is like a best friend , a best advisor and best care taker. 

 This was not my pregnancy journey,  i would rather say an emotional journey for me. Due to many pregnancy uncertainty and few past incidents,  I used to get panic attacks in my last trimester. My husband used to call her and believe me guys no matter how busy she is , she always takes up our call and consoles me. In every visit , she will track my every activities , I wonder how she touches every emotional cord of me and gives the best advise and how to reduce the stress and anxieties. *** ** ********* *** * **** **** *** ** **** The way she handled me throughout my pregnancy journey , a very few doctor can do that. She has all those positive vibes , just a glance of her reduced all my worries and anxieties. I had my last visit with Dr Vinutha Mam, literally I can't forget that day , she examined the Cs stitches and told everything is fine and gave many worth suggestions, my eyes were filled with tears and my heart was wrenching  by this thought that I would not meet doctor in my next visits. I never felt so much warmth , love and care from any doctor in my life. She is a doctor who can be remembered , missed and admired for lifetime.. üôÇüôÇ

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Having Dr.Vinutha B as our obstetrician was a blessing. She is genuinely concerned, cares about her patients not to mention strict when it comes to certain things like exercise and diet. We started seeing her from November 27th 2021 when I was 6 weeks pregnant and met her at cloudnine kanakapura hospital. She accessed me and prescribed folic acid for the first three months and then slowly as I stepped into my fifth month she started talking to me about my protein intake, prescibed calcium and iron supplements and also talked to us about the importance of exercise mainly yoga and how that can help me in having an easy and a less painful normal delivery. She is always thinking about minimizing risks and likes to be informed first hand about anything we feel is not normal and keeps tabs on them. She explains to us as to why she would want certain scans or blood tests done. 
As we were approaching the final leg of pregnancy - the ninth month she took a call and did a membrane sweep after looking at our reports. What soon started as slight pains in my lower abdomen and groin later progressed into an agonizing ordeal of pain which she told us to keep an eye on and to wait. Eventually the next day at 3:45 am the labour pains had already kicked in and my water broke and my husband took me to the hospital. Being my first delivery I was scared and in a lot of pain and didn't know what to expect. The hospital prepped me and took me to the labour room where the doctor walked in soon after. She came in all confident and reassuring and eased me into accepting the reality of what was about to happen the next half hour. Every consultation we had with Dr.Vinutha from the seventh month was about this moment and she had been very clear about what to expect during a normal delivery. We had a very organic delivery and no pain was induced. She monitored my baby's heart and on her orders I pushed. She made calculated cuts measuring in on the baby's head and told me to push for the fourth and final time. With all my might and energy I had with me, I pushed and pushed and into my docter's hand came a beautiful baby girl who I can now proudly say weighed 3.5 kgs. My pain and exhaustion did not seem to matter when I got to hold her for the first time. Dr.Vinutha was always with me when I needed her and each mother and baby is precious to her. I recommend only Dr.Vinutha for anyone I come across needs help or guidance. In the end I wouldn't change a single thing that happened to me during my delivery and hope to see Dr.Vinutha again in a few years for the next one. Thank you Dr.Vinutha for everything you've done for usüòò. Loads of love your way‚ù§Ô∏èüòò.

Kind regards,
Veena & Athreya

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pregnancy Scan,Pre and Post Delivery Care,Labor and Delivery,
review:
Dr. Vinutha B Prashanth is seriously a godsend. She is very patient person who genuinely cares about her patients. Doctor stays near our place so we started consulting in the Divine women clinic from the very first month. Our journey started from November 15th 2021 when I was 6 weeks pregnant. At the very first visit the doctor made us very comfortable and explained all the pros and cons and started with folic tablets. We decided to have a pregnancy journey with the same doctor throughout even if i stay in my mothers place which was quite far of 25kms from the clinic. Doctor used to guide us on food intake and used to clear all our silly doubts.. We used to question her for around half an hour and she used to answer all those without any hesitation. Doctor will not ask to go for unnecessary checkups or blood tests or monthly scans. She thinks our money is her money and asks us not to spend on unwanted scans. She lets us know only if need arises we will go for the scan else a strict no. Best thing about our doctor is that she doesn't give any tablets other than vitamins, calcium and iron tablets and asks us to have home made food to stay healthy throughout our entire pregnancy journey. She focuses more on normal delivery rather than going up for C - section delivery. This was in my mind as i wanted to go for normal delivery and joined yoga sessions as well upon doctors advice from 5th month of pregnancy.
Best part is I didn't have pain or water break till the 39th week and the doctor advised me to wait for one more week and get admitted to hospital. I got admitted to hospital after completing 40 weeks 2 days. Then doctor met me in cloudnine Kanakpura Road, Bangalore and advised me to go for induced pain. Doctor and staff monitored me for 24 hours and then pain started gradually increasing, actually i was shouting at the top of my voice but even then the doctor didn't lose patience and she made me understand about the situation and at last by god's grace and doctor's advice I delivered a baby boy with normal delivery on 21st of July 2022.

All the ones who are out there looking for a better doctor, my sincere advice is to visit Dr. Vinutha mam. No second thoughts please. We are very happy with the things doctor deal with and make us more comfortable. We all feel the doctors to be like her and she is the best example and I love meeting her as she has become very close to us in this entire journey.. Lots of love from our family...

Words are less to thank Dr. Vinutha and her staff - Radhika as she is no different and will go the length to make sure all is well.

Regards,
Sahana & Pawan

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Our story started in Texas, USA. For almost a month, i was having unusual stomach cramp along with sharp back pain. When we consulted our doctor in US, we were diagnosed with an abnormal pregnancy and were on regular HCG count test to track the progress. During this stressful time, we also had travel plans to India which further complicated our situation. During this time, we gave a call to Dr. Vinutha after reading her reviews and the clinics proximity to our house. We were initially worried that traveling from US during covid time, there would be some hesitancy to get an appointment. However, when the doctor spoke to us, she was very calm and understanding. She asked us for the background and made us feel comfortable by reassuring us to come and visit her as soon as we arrive. This made us travel with less worry on our mind.

When we reached Bangalore, we visited an other doctor due to an urgency and had an extremely negative experience. The same day evening we already had a scheduled appointment with Dr Vinutha and went to her with all the history and explained our case. Dr Vinutha spoke to us very nicely and explained to us in detail on the options we had in front of us. We sat almost for 45 minutes and kept asking questions, which she answered to our satisfaction. We continued the care that was needed along with lab tests with her. She expedited our lab tests and called us the next day when the results came in and further explained to us that the option we had chosen to wait was the best based on the outcome of the result. Our next lab test was scheduled in a weeks time. 

After a week, when we visited Dr Vinutha, we asked for an option of surgery since it was more convenient to us based on situations. She again explained to us everything we needed to know and gave thorough inputs on what the surgery would entail. We additionally asked if the surgery can be done somewhere closer since we had another infant to take care of.  Dr Vinutha helped us tremendously by suggesting a few options nearby and finally the surgery was fixed the next morning at 7 am.

The next day, Dr Vinutha arrived early and comforted us saying that things will be fine and the surgery is a minor one. After the surgery, she explained everything that was done (bilateral salpingectomy) and the circumstances leading to it. She came back in the afternoon to check upon us and kept the spirits high. We asked for a favor to have us discharged the same day and after careful consideration she said okay to that as well.

After a week, we visited Dr Vinutha again for the follow up and she removed the stiches and dressed up the wound again. We were checking if we need to visit again, however, she was confident in telling us that things looked fine and we dont have to come back unless there is pain again. She also explained to us to expect everything to get back to normal soon.

As i write this, things are normal and i am able to go back to my life prior to this whole episode. Dr Vinutha's excellent people skills, communication, empathy, willingness to go beyond to help played a crucial role in helping us navigate our situation. We strongly recommend people to visit Dr Vinutha as needed.

Thank you Doctor!

review: Our journey with doctor Vinutha started in August 2021 I was 6week pregnant wen I 1st met her. Actually I didn't know which doctor to choose wen I went to cloud nine then 1of my friend reffed Doctor Vinutha to me she was very friendly in our 1st meet itself I felt very comfortable and felt like I knew her from many years and then I decide that she is the one whom I traveling my pregnancy journey with she used be very particular on everything she used to guide me and she used to clear all my silly doubts  with no hesitation. Every thing was so well and I was very confident on my labour as well as she used to tell me and give me confidence but suddenly on my 33rd week 28th of April 2020 my water broke at 3pm my husband called doctor and informed what happened so she asked us to come to hospital immediately, before we reach there everything was already and they knew that I am coming wen i reached there they took me to scanning and confirmed weather baby head is down are not and checked my fluied lavel baby head was down ,water level was also sufficient and they checked and confirmed that its a labour doctor vinutha kept on calling to duty doctors to know the updates and she was guiding them and in few hours doctor vinutha came to me and she tried to push my labor since it was 33week Bby is pre term but my labor pain started and there was no option then labor in the begging 3 cm was dilated and kept on increasing doctor didn't even go home it was late night she was there with me itself around midnight 1am 8cm was dilated then I was shifted to labor room until then I was totally fine no bp variation and even baby heart rate was 152 every thing was perfect but wen I started to push the babys heart rate suddenly dipped and that was the time where doctor didn't even wait for a second I was shifted to the OT and had to go with C Sec but then wen baby came out baby didn't cry baby had to shifted to NICU and I was fine . Here is what actually makes me happy about Doctor Vinutha is I was delivered and doctor work was done rest everything was taken care by pediatrician but doctor vinutha was always there with my baby she used to go to NICU every day to take update on my baby and she used to call and inform use since I was discharged on my 2nd day after my delivery but baby was there in NICU for 8 long days and doctor used to go every day twice to see her that is really sweet of her and when the day we discharged I could see doctor eyes was filled with tears seeing my baby healthy and till now she keeps texting me and asking about my baby I feel doctors should always be like her she is the best example bcz wen ever I meet her its like I am meeting someone very close to my heart.

review:

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
When i came to know my wife got pregnant i was like on Cloud 9.From practo i j came to know about Dr. Vinutha Prashanth
Then I took a virtual consultation with the Doctor as I was not in Bangalore during that time .From the 1st online consultation I felt like my wife is in safe hands
I truly admire the doctor and the person she is .She congratulated us and prescribed few medicines and asked us to contact her for anything and visit her as soon as we arrive Bangalore

When we reached Bangalore, we visited Dr Vinutha  at Cloudnine Hospital ,Kanakapura. My wife was 28+ weeks pregnant at that time .
We shared all the history that we consulted  in our native place. she went through all the history and did a detailed check of my wife and baby and assured both are absolutely fine

when we asked for scan she said its not required that time  but she does not recommend  for  unnecessary scans and told she will do around 34th weeks .She always insists my wife for Normal delivery and recommended to meditation ,pregnancy exercise .she is always available for the patients .when i say always available its 24/7 just a call or message away

On 9th month of pregnancy my wife felt a little lesser movement of baby. When we informed the Doctor she immediately asked us to do few scans .After that scan report came Dr vinutha called me and informed there is something in CPR values she worried about .Then she informed me  to admit my wife on that day to avoid any unforeseen circumstances

I clearly remember on 18th March she informed me to admit and without any delay we reached cloud nine Kanakpura hospital and did all the admission process

Around 9:30 PM Dr Vinutha came to hospital and met my wife and assured my wife that  everything is alright no need to be worried for anything .There were  few test done like NST during night
During a nonstress test, the baby's heart rate was constantly  monitored to see how it responds to the baby's movements. The duty doctors/nurses used to continuously report the NST results, vitals etc to Dr Vinutha  & she used to watch carefully the reports  and advise accordingly. She kept in constant touch with duty doctors over calls & whatsapp
Around 3 to 3:30 AM at the night the we were informed that there is suspicious result of  NST and need to go for  C-section or caesarean delivery immediately

In midnight a 3:30--:3:45  AM  Dr. Vinutha came to hospital and informed me she will go for emergency caesarean delivery because of suspicious result of  NST

About 4:00 AM Dr went to OT and at 4:15 AM in the early morning my baby angel came into the world .
I was nervous before the surgery but being in great hands of yours has made things much easier. Thank you!
No words would ever be enough to express our gratitude. Thank you for bringing our angel to earth
My baby is very fortunate to have been born through your hands. Thank you for all the support and care, doctor. I will forever remember your wonderful treatment and care for both the baby and my wife . Thank you for your excellent service. May God bless you.

I will never forget the doctor who always smiles and talks with patients very humbly . Your bright aura brings so much joy and inner healing.

I remember that you used to say my wife ..Jaya !!! its normal

No words are enough to appreciate the service you do. You as a doctor and the humble person you are .
The world would be a much better place if all of the doctors were like you. Thank you so much for everything that you have done.

You‚Äôre such a delightful person and a dedicated doctor, you truly are an inspiration! Stay blessed.

review:
Five stars are not enough rather I would like to give infinite stars to Dr. Vinutha Mam. 

This review might feel very lengthy but I could not make my imotions and feelings more precise than this.

Dr. Vinutha Mam is not just a doctor she is like God for us. We started consulting her in April 2021 for my first pregnency. Entire 9 months of interaction with her always gave positive energy to me. For most of my health complaints she used to say "Prajakta, it's normal" these worlds never made me worry about anything during that hard time. Mam never asked me to do any unnecessary Scans or Tests. In 8th month I had preterm labour and was admitted in the hospital. That was very defficult time for me and my husband but mam made sure we get enough medical and emotional support from her. My family wanted us to come to our home town for delivery but I wanted to be in Bangalore just because Vinutha mam is here. After this I was all fine and not called her for almost 3 weeks. She herself called me from her busy schedule to check how I am doing and why I didn't call her. I was almost about to cry to see how much she cares for her patients. 

After 9 months rollers coster ride finally we blessed with baby boy on 1st Feb(full term baby) through Normal delivery. At the time of delivery she was with me in the hospital for almost 7-8 hours and made sure I don't give up and its normal delivery. Mam I am really thankful for this for my lifetime üôè******** ***** *** * ****** *** *** ** when my Mom came to Bangalore I took her to Mam for gynaecologist checkup in which Mam identified her life threatening illness and guided us for its treatment by referring to perfect doctors. She never said I can't help you, this is not my area of concern and so on.... Every time she made sure we get right treatment for my mother. She saved my mother's life by doing diagnosis on right time. Thanks you so much Mam for saving saving my mother's life. 

Mam is very dedicated to her profession. She will always make sure treatment you get is THE BEST in very affordable price. I can't imagine my delivery and my Mom's surgery without her. 

Now the thought of not visiting her every month makes me restless. We will definitely miss every months visit to her clinic üòî

Me and my family will be always thankful for all the strength and support you gave us üôèüòä

I recommend Dr. Vinutha Mam very strongly if you are planning pregnancy or have any gynecological issue. *** ** *** ** *** **** ****** ** ********** No matter which area you stay in Bangalore the experience is worth that travel.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pregnancy Check Up,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
We randomly came across a new women's clinic in our area named Divine Clinic run by Dr.Vinutha Prashanth and thought to check it out for issue with my irregular periods. We were just planning for a baby then. In the 1st clinic visit itself, we were filled with positivity and hope. The doctor confidently said I will conceive within the next 3 months & it happened too! I conceived within 2 months and went ahead with my pregnancy consultations too at Divine clinic itself and had a smooth & safe natural delivery! The labour was an induced one due to my low AFI value and the doctor didn't rush for a C-section. The whole induction process was well explained to me the previous day and taken as slow and natural as possible which helped me cope up with the contraction pains. The doctor was present at hospital throughout my labour. The duty doctors/nurses used to continuously report my NST results, vitals etc to Vinutha mam & she used to vigilantly assess them and advise accordingly. She kept in constant touch with duty doctors over calls & whatsapp and visited me personally every now & then to assess my labour progress first hand. The doctor was patient & vigilant throughout my labour and took some timely decisions to help me & the baby when the FHR started dropping. Luckily, I delivered within 3-4 hours of getting good contractions. 
Post delivery, the doctor came to check on me at the odd hours around 10pm  and i was in awe of the kind of family support she must have had. She was at hospital from morning till late night that day. We are very lucky to have found an empathetic doctor like Vinutha mam. 
Reasons why you should choose Dr.Vinutha mam :
1. Vinutha mam is one of the sweetest gynaecologist I have ever met. She is super friendly, always smiling, welcomes you warmly, empathetic and genuinely cares for the patient. In the first visit itself, I'm sure you will get that positive vibe that she is the doctor you can blindly trust & go ahead with. She would give ample time to listen to you no matter what. Every visit is like that, not even once we felt we were not attended properly. She will be like a good friend to you, I bet on that! 
2. She is very passionate about her profession, possess great work ethics, very transparent and never advises unnecessary follow ups/tests/scans/medicines. 
3. She is very approachable & directly available on calls and whatsapp for all patient queries/concerns 24x7 and given her hectic schedule, you will be surprised at the super quick responses you get each time from her.
4. The clinic visits are hassle free. The timings of your appointment are maintained well. All blood tests are done at the clinic itself by the doctor & medicines provided too. The blood test results are promptly updated to you over a call & you can collect them in your next clinic visit at your convenience! All scan/test reports are assessed through whatsapp and no follow ups asked if they are normal!
How much more easy can it get! :)
5. She insists on natural/vaginal birth. 
6. Whenever there is a need for internal check up/pelvic exam, she gently talks to the patient, comforts them first, informs them about the procedure & it's need. This is an important quality a gynaecologist should possess in my opinion. 

Lastly, Going through childbirth is a mix of immense pain followed by immense happiness. In this journey, the presence of a wonderful doctor is simply priceless. Thank you Dr. Vinutha mam for everything and may God bless you abundantly :

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Hi I am glad that I found Dr Vinutha. My whole family is impressed by the way she works. From the confirmation of my pregnancy till post delivery, it's been a smooth journey with her. All my doubts and questions have been answered patiently and on time. She accepts the patients as they are and never complain back, always welcome will her great and simple smile. She gets emotionally attached and hence we feel like sharing our thoughts with our family member. She also explains and make us understand the health issues so well that we will be educated about the things very well. Vinutha Mam is a very friendly, patience, lovely and a safe Dr. to consult. 
I would like to tell about my experience on the day of the delivery. During my regular checkup and follow up Dr was very positive for normal delivery as I had no complications, my height was good and all factors were favoring normal delivery. On that day from morning I was not happy with the baby moments. As per Dr advice I called her after waiting for some time. She asked me to get the NST test done from a nearby hospital and send the report immediately. I got the test done and sent the report. Dr was not happy with the report and asked me to come down to cloudnine. In cloudnine the test was repeated, she was in constant touch with the duty doctors and even got the scan done. She visited the hospital and told us that she was not happy with the results of the NST test and did not want to take chance by sending me back home. She got me admitted and told that she would induce pains in the night and try for normal delivery. In the hospital the doctors monitored me and were updating the same to Dr Vinutha. At around 10.30 my NST report was fluctuating a lot and even pains had started. The baby heart beat was going down when I got my pains. The Duty Dr after consulting Dr Vinutha broke my water bag to checked if baby had passed motion, it was clear and baby had not passed motion. After breaking the water bag my pains increased, Dr Vinutha rushed to the hospital at around 12 at night she came and explained the situation to my family, my babies heart beat was dropping when I got my pains. She told that she could wait for normal delivery only if the heart beat was stable, and she was asking for our consent we gave Dr free hand to take decision. She informed us that she was not keen on waiting taking into account the situation and rushed me to the operation theater for C section. I was taken for C section and I delivered a baby boy at 12.45 night. My baby was almost blue when he was born and was rushed to NICU as he was facing breathing difficulty. Dr Vinutha finished my surgery waited for the pediatrician to check my child went and spoke to the pediatrician and confirmed that the baby is doing good before leaving the hospital at around 2.30 in the night. Later we came to know that I had a placenta abruption (a very rare scenario) and had blood clots on the uterus because of which my baby was not getting required blood and oxygen. I was very lucky enough that Dr Vinutha mam took a correct and timely decision to take me for C section. Because of Dr Vinutha I and my baby are safe and healthy today. Me and my family are indebted to Dr Vinutha Mam. Thanks a lot Mam for your kind gestures. I will infact miss meeting you every month henceforth .
reply_text: Kavita , thank you so much for your love and affection, I miss you too. God bless you and baby üíó

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Here is my amazing experience with a wonderful doctor. 

I convinced in the month of March and the COVID situation arised everywhere. Not knowing which doctor to consult due to travelling restrictions we started to look for a doctor close to our house. 

That's when we came across Doctor Vinutha and her reviews were so good, hence we tried to give her a shot. Trust me I visited her once and I never looked back. 

Not only me but my entire family is in awe of her... Like you have already read that she shares her personal number through which she is in constant touch with you and clarifies all your normal to silly doubts, and guides you during emergencies. 

During my pregnancy she was very encouraging and sweet, she always encouraged me to do my work and keep myself busy and preoccupied. She never stopped me from anything, let it be eating or playing. The Only time she ever told me no was to stop me from drinking soda and eating fast foods. 

Doctor never asked me to visit her that frequently looking at the situation, she asked me to get my tests done and WhatsApp her the reports. She was always available to talk let it be during the night or early morning. 
She would happily respond to all my doubts and quiries without getting irritated. 

The pregnancy was smooth till 7th month, as I entered my 8th month, I started getting severe cramps and pain. I had entered into early labour and doctor admitted me immediately for observation. She not only personally stayed in touch with my parents but Also expained to us why she admitted me. She was very sure on not to get me into early delivery. She did everything possible to make sure I don't deliver and then when I was stable she sent be home and asked me to be on bed rest till I completed my 9 months. 

I had constant contactions but doctor was very positive and was very sure that she wanted me to have a normal delivery, hence she always gave me an option to induce my pain to deliver but also explained the consequences and encouraged me to have a normal delivery. 

We waited and then I made it till week 39. But due to unavoidable circumstances my doctor had to go out of station and I completely understand because in this 9 months I have never heard her saying she is on leave or on break. I have always heard her say I had delivery, my patients are waiting etc. Once I visited twice in a gap of three days and those three days too she was just at hospital making sure her patients had safe delivery. 

Hence, when she said unavoidable situation, I could completely understand and she ensured me that in her absence if I enter into labour she will make sure that I'll have the most safe and secure delivery. And what I feared came upon me, I entered into labour in my doctor's absence. The best part was even when she was traveling she replied to all my messages. when I got admitted due to my Labour pain, my doctor requested Dr. Varna Rao to take care of me and my delivery. Dr. Vinutha was in constant touch with Dr. Varna and dr. Varna was updating her about my progression. 
When I entered my active labour I still remember dr. Varna called my doctor to tell that I was ready to deliver and that she was going ahead with the delivery. 

I had the most safest delivery,  if am not wrong my active labour ended in less than two minutes and I am blessed with a beautiful baby girl. All thanks to my dear doctors. They did not induce labour pain, nor did they mess with the process, but they waited patiently..they made sure I had the most normal, natural and safest delivery. 

I specifically want to thank my doctor vinutha for encouraging me since day 1 and preparing me and my body for natural birth by encouraging me and strengthening me.. 

And yes a person can never do so much without the support from her family, the way her family supports and encourages her is just amazing, hats off to her and her blessed family... I am in awe of dr. Vinutha and her family. I am happy I met a person/ doctor like her in my life's journey who has become so close to my heart. ‚ù§Ô∏è 

Thank you doctor for everything. 
She is someone anyone can blindly trust on!!
reply_text: Thank you so much for understanding doctors plight, u are gem of a person sheetal, im touched by your words, its an inspiration for me to work more and give my üíØ to my patients.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My wife, after several years got pregnant through IVF, went to IVF hospital in the month of October and in November we got the sweet result. After that regular checkup, every thing was going well, 1st trimester then 2nd trimester we started countdown but at the start of 3rd trimester, Doctor then revealed that she had short cervix in the month of Jun with 29 weeks of pregnancy, doctor said that she will have preterm delivery. The word preterm shocked us, baby going to NICU, growing with the support of machines, thinking of it was very scary. We didn't know what to do, the doctor said to be on full bed rest and to try to pull upto 34weeks. That was very long way to go.
Then after that began the search for this situation, went to near by hospitals but there were no NICU for that long of preterm. Then went to all known hospital there the doctor advised for cervical cerclage, there she said that as  it will be a preterm why not to take chances. We couldn't agree with her.
Next day contacted a hospital which had Level III NICU, then we said the issue, after which the hospital staff gave us number of Dr Vinutha Prashanth. By then doctor herself called us and we told entire event. She then called us to the hospital. Next day we went to hospital where my wife was examined, after that Dr Vinutha explained every thing in detail as to what would happen and what and all treatment will be needed in case of preterm delivery. She then said my wife will have normal delivery. That was different as IVF pregnancies usually have to go through C section. Dr Vinutha explanation  was very simple to understand and we were convinced with her. Later doctor advised to get admitted as my wife needed complete bed rest not to get out of bed other than to the washroom.
After that my wife was monitored daily through examination and NST. There was Dr Vinutha checking  twice daily. Dr Vinutha, she is excellent in her approach towards the case. ***** ********** *** *********** **** ** *********. Doctor then got as USG done to check the growth and condition of the baby. She said that the baby is good and not to worry. After 33 weeks Dr Vinutha was very positive that my wife may hold on upto 34-35 weeks, then there was no fear of baby going to NICU, as the baby was doing well in her mother's tummy. Then the day came at 34.3weeks, at around 6 in the evening water came out, my wife was shifted to labour room and at 9pm we had a baby boy delivered normally, no C section, Dr Vinutha was there delivering my baby, as promised she got him by normal delivery. Our baby was 2.2kg, Neonatologists were there who checked on and said that the baby is healthy and doing good. Our baby was in NICU for a day only for check up. Next day he was there with her mother. 
All thanks to our Dr Vinutha Prashanth, her professionalism, determination, kindness and excellent approach towards the case, made our life. Just one thing to say "she is one gem of a doctor". Finally we would like to say that one can blindly go to Dr Vinutha Prashanth, one will like her in first visit. Just trust, rest leave it to Dr Vinutha Prashanth. We are really greatful to her.

Contacted & Visited Dr Vinutha from initial Pregnancy Check, UpPre, Post Delivery Care & Normal Delivery.
Happy to update that with her very utmost care & concerns we are blessed with baby boy (from Normal delivery)  
During my wife‚Äôs first pregnancy we had consulted Dr (Gynecologists) who is in Vijayanagar (Bangalore South) after meeting a couple of Gynecologists. She was good in advising, but not to the level of care or information‚Äôs to be passed for the 1st pregnancy lady. We were not so satisfied with the overall interactions & consultations.
But for my wife‚Äôs 2nd pregnancy we had contacted Dr Vinutha Prashanth as we had come to know about her professionalism, utmost care for her patient‚Äôs, guiding, consulting with clearing every doubts with patience etc through my cousins wife who got consultations from her.

When we met her for the first time itself we were very impressed & surprised to see the Dr in Bangalore (even in her busy schedules) with so much of patience to list to patients & guiding with all instructions giving confidence of all assurance from her side. 
For example- She gave her number on our 1st visit itself & asked to call her anytime if incase of any problem or inconveniences caused which we hardly see in many a doctor‚Äôs.
Her way of talking, concerns & confidence giving consultations gave a full strength to my wife. In her 2nd pregnancy I never saw my wife worried or tensed or uncomfortable (having certain doubts in mind). Which I had seen lots of those kinds in her 1st pregnancy. 
We both don‚Äôt any words to express about car taking of her patients. It‚Äôs just awesome & unimaginable. I feel we just don‚Äôt have any words to express & just say thanks to her.
One main thing I have to say that we are basically from north Karnataka & had decision of going to our home town for the delivery. But because of Dr Vinutha Prashanth‚Äôs care & her professionalism we canceled our plan & decided to have the delivery from her itself.
For your updates it was not mine or my wife‚Äôs decision but it was whole of our family‚Äôs decision to have the delivery from her side. So you can understand what her impression is & believe our whole family is having. 
On the delivery day we called Dr Vinutha Prashanth before leaving the house & reached Ovum hospital at 5.15 AM. Even at that odd hour she visited immediately & gave confidence & assurance to my wife. And till my wife leaves for labor room she was either present in the hospital or was taking continuous updates from the duty doctor. Infact she use to give me also the confidence that not worry & everything will be alright. She was continuously monitoring on how my wife was progressing, baby's health (heartbeat) and kept the OT ready in case of any emergencies. She has been calm and patient with us throughout this pregnancy.
By God's grace everything went well. Both the mother and the baby are healthy and doing well.
Thank you so much from bottom of my heart for your all the help Dr Vinuth.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Finding the right gynecologist for my first pregnancy was a significant decision. It involved researching, seeking recommendations and to ensure I made the best choice. Hence I am taking this time to express and thank an awesome gynaecologist - Dr Vinutha Prashanth. 
It marked the beginning of a partnership that would provide me with the best care and support during this precious time.

During my first appointment with Dr Vinutha I eventually chose, I knew I had found the right doctor. Her wealth of knowledge and experience in obstetrics reassured me that I was in capable hands.She  provided guidance throughout my pregnancy journey. She answered my questions patiently, addressed my concerns, and ensured that I was well informed about each stage of pregnancy. What made her truly exceptional was the personalized care she provided. She took the time to understand my unique needs and concerns, tailoring her approach to ensure well-being of me and my baby.

Her expertise and compassion helped me navigate the challenges and joys of pregnancy with confidence.Her unwavering patience, refusal to prescribe unnecessary medications and tests, and thorough explanations at every stage of pregnancy set her apart. Driven by a genuine concern for both mother and child, she consistently emphasized the importance of staying healthy and taking necessary precautions. When a cervical stitch was deemed necessary based on a scan, she prioritized my comfort, seeking multiple opinions before proceeding and prescribing the right medications to alleviate potential pain and discomfort. 

Dr. Vinutha's accessibility through calls and WhatsApp played a crucial role in maintaining my peace of mind throughout the pregnancy. Beyond her medical expertise, she proved to be a wonderful person, fully dedicated to her role. My journey to full term was eased by her guidance, and I am grateful for her exceptional care. We are blessed with a baby girl and Thank you so much doctor for being a significant part of this beautiful journey.

review: I consulted Dr. Vinutha for my second pregnancy post having minor complications with my first delivery. Naturally I was quite anxious and had many queries for every consultation I had with her. Dr Vinutha not only answered my queries but also made me feel comfortable to ask in those queries and made me feel valid. I was reassured at every consultation. The best thing with her consultation was that I was provided with complete information at every stage of my pregnancy and was made aware of my choices and it's impact. Along with this , she was available on WhatsApp for any quick queries and report consultation which saved us from multiple consultation visits. Due to my gestation diabetes, I was recommended with an induction at my 39  week. Although the initial plan was to have gel, with my dilation and labour progress, I was allowed to dilate naturally until my active labour phase post which I was induced via IV for progress. I was calmly and compassionately guided during my delivery. I owe my pleasant experience both the pregnancy as well as my delivery to her. I would definitely recommend her if you are looking for happier and healthy pregnancy  delivery

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
To be very frank we opted Dr Vinutha based on review on various online platform. During our first visit itself we felt that we made right choice by opting her.
As it was my first pregnancy was bit scared but doctor made us so comfortable and enquired in detail about the history of pregnancy and was very patient in understanding everything we narrated.
She always prescribed basic tablets (calcium and iron) even though we asked her "is that all? :-)
After completion of 37th week we were bit concerned but doctor always said with smile on her face "wait till due date whats the hurry". At end of 39th week which was nearing due date, since there was no pain , doctor asked to admit so that pain can be induced.
Doctor explained each and every process of pain induction, what are possible outcome, what are following process for each outcome.
After couple of induction there was no improvement. 
At this stage even we thought it would be C section. But doctor again gave us couple of options and she was the one who was trying all possible way to get normal delivery done.
And after third pain induction, everything fell in place and by Gods grace we are blessed with little angel.
Not sure how many doctor would have done that but we will be always thankful to Dr Vinutha for pushing us and guiding us in right path.
I would definetly recommed Dr Vinutha and you will be always greeted with lovely smile on her face which will make you feel that you are in safe hands.

Thank you again doctor.

Dr. Vinutha Prashanth's approach not only enhances the overall birth experience but also contributes to better maternal and neonatal outcomes.
Her compassionate demeanor, expertise in handling complex situations, and reluctance to prescribe unnecessary medication or tests make her an exceptional choice for anyone seeking comprehensive and patient-focused gynecological care. I highly recommend her.

review:
We visited Cloud Nine Hospital on Kanakapura Road for pre- and post-pregnancy care. Throughout our experience at the hospital, we received exceptional treatment from Dr. Vinutha. She was the second doctor we consulted during my pregnancy as we shifted our residence, and we noticed a significant difference between the two experiences. Dr. Vinutha is truly an amazing doctor who treats her patients with the utmost care and makes them feel comfortable discussing their problems. She avoids recommending unnecessary medicines or scans and is always professional and understanding.

Dr. Vinutha's approach to patient care was a breath of fresh air. She didn't just treat us as patients, but as human beings. She listened to our concerns, addressed our questions and provided us with clear explanations of what was happening with my pregnancy. She shared her knowledge and expertise with us, without ever making us feel like we were being talked down to. Her compassionate approach to medicine made us feel at ease, and we felt confident that we were in good hands.

One of the things that stood out to us was Dr. Vinutha's willingness to go above and beyond. She shared her phone number with us and replied promptly to our queries via WhatsApp and phone calls, unlike the previous doctor we consulted. She even checked up on us after hours to make sure everything was going smoothly. This level of care and attention to detail made us feel valued as patients.

Dr. Vinutha's guidance and motivation during the pregnancy were invaluable. She constantly guided us on how to prepare for a normal delivery and encouraged us to stay positive and confident throughout the process.

We can confidently say that opting for Dr. Vinutha's care at the last minute was one of the best decisions we made during the pregnancy. We highly recommend her to anyone in need of exceptional medical care and support during pregnancy and childbirth.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Pregnancy care and management,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
We visited Dr Vinutha at Divine clinic at Katriguppe when my wife was pregnant. Starting from the confirmation of pregnancy till the delivery my wife had many ups and downs and we got proper guidance and support from Dr. Vinutha throughout. Even post-delivery she kept in touch with us and celebrated like a family member. 


At every visit. Dr. Vinutha explains what is happening and explains the changes to mother and baby. She does not recommend unnecessary medications, scans and tests. She recommends proper diet and exercise to follow during pregnancy. She communicates clearly at every step and helps us resolve all our doubts.

She is very experienced and has clear understanding of what needs to be done in case of emergency. She handles risks effectively. During the pregnancy my wife had some complications in second trimester. Dr. Vinutha identified that, explained clearly what the issue is and explained the consequences and what needs to be done further. She got my wife admitted to hospital immediately, performed the required emergency procedure and prevented further issues. After that she clearly explained the steps, pros and cons and the steps we needed to follow further for the rest of the pregnancy. She had us prepared mentally for the rest of our journey. She explained what will constitute emergency for us and asked us to call immediately if we see those signs.


In last trimester, my wife had signs of labor during early morning, and I could call her immediately. She informed the Cloud nine, Kanakpura hospital in advance and had them prepared in advance. She came to the hospital early and my wife had a normal delivery of baby girl. Since it was early pre-term the baby was kept in NICU for some days. She kept in touch with us regularly monitored the progress of our baby with pediatrician parallelly and continued advising us on the same. She suggested us on all the possibilities of handling the hospital bill for both baby and mother.

Thanks to Dr. Vinutha both me and my wife were able to handle the tough situations during pregnancy and keep ourselves positively throughout our journey.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We chose Dr Vinutha through online reviews. We visited her in cloudnine kanakpura branch. In our first visit itself we were convinced to continue with her. She is very friendly, listens attentively and comfortable to approach. She asks only for necessary tests, scans and explains why they are needed. She is available on whatsapp for queries.

Unexpectedly in 33rd week i had aminuotic fluid leak and was admitted. I gave sleepless nights to Dr. She was very supportive and clearly explained family members about the next proceedings. Dr. was strongly trying to push delivery by a week so that baby develops well in womb. Medicines were provided for lung development, to avoid infection , scans and NST were done regularly. This was my first pregnancy after 6 years of marriage and she knew how precious this baby was for us. She was genuinely caring and focused towards safe delivery of baby.
On 5th day after admission early in the morning baby heart rate increased and Dr. immediately took the call for c section. I was quickly shifted to labor ward , everything went well and was blessed with baby boy.
Furthermore, i faced severe gastritis issue before and after delivery. Scans , ECGs were done and Dr. assessed the situation and provided medication accordingly. From admission till discharge Dr. visited us frequently, monitored  constantly and guided  the duty staff.  She was always available when needed and gave me confidence throughout my delivery.
I am glad we chose Dr. Vinutha. I strongly recommend her to my friends and relatives. 
Thanks Dr. for all you have done for us. Wish you and your family good health and happiness.
Lots of love ‚ù§Ô∏è Ramya & Anand

review:
Our journey with Dr.Vinutha mam was a happy experience. We had chosen her from online reviews and gone with a
positive ray of hope, which was worth it. She is a friendly person and welcomes with a warmth and smile always.
She never hesitates to answer even the silly queries that we put forth. The clinic is maintained well, credits to her
assistant in charge who takes care of all these stuff. Till my 9 months of checkup whenever we meet its always been 
a conversation with loads of smile and no hard feelings.
During the phase of pregnancy i had the normal checkups and scans done smoothly, and never had any complications.
she will suggest only the tests or scans that is needed based on the individuals health concern. She's very reachable, she replies to your questions over WhatsApp and also responds to calls in emergency situations.
Ideally, the whole journey of pregnancy and checkup was completely a cakewalk for me.

This was my 2nd pregnancy after a gap of 7 years, and i personally had so much confusions of choosing normal or 
c-section since my first baby is also c-section. but doctor took time to make us understand on the risks involved 
in opting normal after c-section even though there is a long gap, she gave clear idea on scar ruptures that happen for 
the mother when second is a normal delivery. Thinking of my health and baby to struggle more to get normally delivered,
we mentally got fine with opting a planned C-section. During the delivery time, all process went smoothly and i never
felt any anguish or complexity. By God's grace and Doctor's effort , delivered girl baby on 30th July 2022.
The baby was healthy and weighed 3.6. Baby health was constant and good sign to discharge in two days of delivery.
I strongly recommend to go with Dr.Vinutha for a smooth pregnancy journey and delivery phase. 
She always enquire about the my health and baby‚Äôs health even after the delivery.  I don‚Äôt think any of the other doctors will do a follow up after the delivery. Thanks to Dr.Vinutha mam and team of Cloudnine for making the delivery a smooth phase and return home healthily.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I‚Äôm very happy to have Dr.Vinutha Prashanth as my obstetrician for several reasons. I first visited her for my delayed periods with PCOS and she motivated me to take up  good lifestyle habits and diet plan which corrected my cycles with very less medication and since then she has been with me throughout my pregnancy journey as well. 

I have been seeing her since day 1 of my pregnancy, she explains all the necessary things in detail and she always motivated me to take up my pregnancy very well. She only suggest necessary scans and medications throughout, also very well explains the need of every scan, blood tests and medications. I had been very active throughout my pregnancy and all thanks to her. She was always a phone call away for any of my queries at any time of the day. 

Although I had completed 40 weeks of my pregnancy, I did not have any symptoms of labour then she clearly explained me about inducing labour since I always wanted NVD and Dr.Vinutha as well motivated me to go for NVD. 

At the end of 40th week I opted for labour induction and the procedure started and it went for a day and half long and my body did not support the medication and it was a failed induction, also baby‚Äôs head was not yet fixed which made it more difficult. Throughout the process she made sure that she had a constant check on my condition and she always took care of me. 

After all this, she clearly explained me the process of waiting for labour pain and consequences and then we decided to go for C-section late in the night and immediately informed her. She did not hesitate to visit us late in the night and to take up the operation at that time. I was so relaxed to see her at that time since I knew that me and my baby were in safe hands. 

Went into OT at 9:50 PM and we had our beautiful girl with us by 10:10 PM. I‚Äôm always grateful to Dr. Vinutha Prashant for her humbleness, commitment, care and concern she has towards her patients. 

She has also helped my cousins and friends with their gynaecology problems as well and they are happy with the results. 

I would strongly recommend Dr.Vinutha to all the women around. 

Thank you so much 
Vishala

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Firstly my wife and I want to thank Google  suggesting wonderful gynecologist in our locality. Also, clinic is maintained very well.

We visited Divine Women's Healthcare clinic after seeing reviews which are posted in Google. Trust us it was not a surprise in the other way, doctor is very much approachable, polite and humble. We have never seen such a polite and friendly doctor in our entire life. Doctor responds to our call and messages if we need any information or in the matter of emergency. 

We met Doctor Vinutha when my wife was one month pregnant. Doctor had clearly explained all the  plan of actions that we need to take care in this nine months journey in every stages.

Doctor usually don't recommend too many scannings or medical tests unless there are any irregularities. However, she recommends scannings for mother at each trimester to determine the growth/health of baby. 

Usually other doctors recommends their own set of hospital for delivery based on their convenience. But Vinutha doctor will respect our decision to choose hospital for delivery based on the proximity from our locality. 

As the date was approaching towards delivery doctor was so friendly with my wife as the level of trauma reduceds to some extent. 

During final trimester my wife suffered from Polyhydramnios. Doctor had politely made us understand what are the concequences that we may come across in the future and we were also mentally prepared for that. 

Due to above extremely condition my wife had to go for cesarean delivery as we don't want to risk mother's or baby's life. Upon our decision doctor agreed to take case. 

On the date of case doctor was very much approachable and she always respected our decision.

On 20th July 2022 my wife and I have been blessed with cute girl baby‚ù§Ô∏è We are extremely happyüòä

Post pregnancy doctor had taken utmost care of my wife until she is discharged from the hospital. 

I have never seen such a dedicated doctor in my entire life for making betterment in patients life üòä

Finally, Megha, my daughter Charishya and i want to thank doctor for taking utmost care and making this journey a memorable one‚ù§Ô∏è
